cluster_name: lawn with scattered trees and built elements
cluster_description: Moderate NDVI (mean ~0.54) plots dominated by low-stature vegetation (herb cover ≈46%) with low shrub and tree cover and appreciable built surface (~39%). Characteristic of managed lawns, park turf or garden lawns interspersed with paths/buildings and a few scattered trees.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by contiguous short, regularly mown turf forming an open, low-stature sward. Narrow paved footpaths cross or bound the plots and scattered trees occur as isolated vertical elements within the grassy matrix. Built elements, principally residential buildings and adjacent infrastructure, are visible beyond the vegetation boundary, producing a mosaic of lawn, isolated trees and nearby hard surfaces. Plots exhibit long sightlines (>30 m) and consistent evidence of regular lawn management.

cluster_description: Very high NDVI (mean ~0.86) and the highest large-tree cover (≈39.5%), low built cover (~8%) and moderate understorey. Matches dense, mature tree canopy typical of urban woodlands or mature park tree stands.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are dominated by a continuous, closed tree canopy with dense understorey and limited sightlines (visibility generally on the order of 10–30 m). Vegetation is structurally complex, with multiple mature trunks and an established shrub/ground layer beneath the canopy. Plots show no formal access infrastructure or built elements, exhibit very low evidence of management (described as very low/wild maintenance), and have minimal visual clutter or anthropogenic detritus.

cluster_description: High NDVI (mean ~0.76) and very high herbaceous cover (≈69%), with very low shrub and only modest tree cover and low built cover. Fits open, herbaceous-dominated areas such as meadows, long-grass parkland or unmanaged grassland patches.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterised by a continuous layer of tall herbaceous vegetation forming an open meadow. Scattered trees occur at the plot margin, creating a background tree line while the central plot area remains dominated by tall herbs. No paved or informal paths, built structures, or other infrastructure are visible within the plots; maintenance indicators are low (semi‑wild) with no evidence of recent mowing. Visibility across the plots is moderate (approximately 10–30 m), and no people or vehicles are present.

cluster_name: parkland with scattered trees and shrubs
cluster_description: High NDVI (mean ~0.80) with a mixed vertical structure: substantial herb layer (~48%), noticeable shrub (~12%) and both small and large trees (~12% and ~17% respectively) and low built cover (~11%). Characteristic of parkland with scattered trees and shrub patches (structured greenspace).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots exhibited a heterogeneous greenspace mosaic dominated by open tall-herb meadows interspersed with shrub-dominated and tree-dominated patches. Structural variation ranged from open, long-sight plots with wide herbaceous cover to closed-woodland plots with dense understorey; visibility distances therefore varied from short (<10 m) to long (>30 m). Informal earth or mud paths of narrow to medium width are present in multiple plots, while a minority contained mown grass tracks or recent mowing. Maintenance intensity recorded across plots varied from very low/wild to moderate (occasional recent mowing); visible clutter, litter, built infrastructure and people were generally absent.

cluster_description: Low–moderate NDVI (mean ~0.42) and the highest built cover among vegetated clusters (built ≈53%), with low to moderate herb and shrub cover and very low tree cover. Consistent with heavily built urban blocks with sparse planted vegetation (street planting, small garden patches, courtyards).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by extensive sealed ground and vehicular circulation, with wide paved surfaces (roads/parking) forming the dominant groundcover and residential buildings forming hard plot boundaries. Vegetation within plots is limited and peripheral, consisting of small patches of shrubs and occasional trees located at the margins rather than across the interior. Open space is present but largely expressed as paved or otherwise impermeable surface; line-of-sight across plots is moderate (approximately 10–30 m), indicating an open, low-vertical-structure environment.

cluster_description: Moderate NDVI (mean ~0.61) and a relatively even mix of herb, shrub and tree cover (herb ≈37%, shrub ≈13%, small & large trees ≈10% each) and moderate built cover (~30%). Suggestive of heterogeneous suburban greenspace or multi-layered vegetation patches (shrub–tree mosaics).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots exhibited an open herbaceous layer (recently mown grass) interspersed with patches of shrubs and scattered trees, producing a heterogeneous, multi‑layered shrub–tree mosaic. Some plots included small standing water bodies with floating vegetation (lily pads). Vegetation arrangement indicates a mix of open grassy areas and denser shrub/tree patches within individual plots.

cluster_description: Very low NDVI (mean ~0.27) and extremely high built cover (≈79%) with minimal herb, shrub or tree cover. Matches impervious urban surfaces and hard-standing with negligible vegetation.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterised by extensive continuous impervious surface (paved hard standing) with painted parking-bay markings. Vegetation is minimal and largely confined to peripheral elements (scattered trees and narrow vegetated edges), resulting in low vertical structural complexity and negligible herbaceous or shrub cover within the plot. Plots are open with medium-range visibility (≈10–30 m) and present as well-maintained built surfaces dominated by hard standing.

cluster_description: High NDVI (mean ~0.70) with moderate herb cover (~38%) and a notable large-tree component (~20%), intermediate built cover (~29%). Indicative of treed parkland or suburban areas where grass and a moderate canopy coexist (more canopy than scattered-tree parkland but less than mature woodland).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by a continuous, regularly mown herbaceous sward beneath a discontinuous canopy of mature trees, producing an open understorey. Vegetation structure is tree-dominated with scattered mature trees over an extensive short-grass layer. Plots exhibit signs of moderate management (recent mowing) and retain visual depth through layered tree canopy and groundcover.

cluster_description: Very high herbaceous cover (≈94%) and very low shrub, tree and built cover (built ≈2%). Very high NDVI (mean ~0.79). Characteristic of continuous closed sward such as intensively managed amenity grassland (sports fields, closely mown lawns) or very large turf areas.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots were dominated by continuous, short herbaceous swards forming extensive open turf with long sightlines (>30 m). Plots uniformly lacked formal paths and exhibited minimal visual clutter (visual clutter score = 1); no litter, parked vehicles or street furniture were visible. Several plots showed evidence of recent or regular mowing and were managed at moderate to high maintenance intensity. Perimeter elements typically comprised tree lines or scattered shrubs; built or paved infrastructure was generally absent within the turf, though a subset of plots showed distant buildings on the horizon.
